required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dosage Schedule Study of Pemetrexed Monochemotherapy for Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: Pemetrexed Monochemotherapy in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer. A Pilot Study to Define the Best Dosing Schedule for a Planned Phase II Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Patients affected by non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) will be treated in pemetrexed monochemotherapy regimen for a maximum of 8 cycles. Pemetrexed is an enhancer of some biomolecules involved in the gemcitabine mechanism of action. Purpose of the trial is to monitor the blood values of these biomolecules at different time intervals, to optimize the synergism between pemetrexed and gemcitabine.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Deoxycytidine Kinase (dCK) Expression Evaluated at Cycle 1, Cycle 2, and Cycle 3
Mean Human Equilibrative Nucleoside Transporter 1 (hENT) Expression Evaluated at Cycle 1, Cycle 2, and Cycle 3

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured response (every 14 days for 6 cycles)

intervention.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue
500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Histologically or cytologically proven IIIB and IV NSCLC.
- No symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastasis
- Not suitable for platinum containing regimens if chemo-naive
- Performance status less than or equal to 2 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Scale.
- Creatinine Clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 45 milliliters per min (mL/min)
Exclusion Criteria
- Prior radiation to greater than 25% of bone marrow
- Inability to interrupt Aspirin at doses of greater than 1.3 grams/day or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agents for a 5-day period.
- Presence of clinically relevant third-space fluid collections not controllable.
- Significant cardiac disease

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 19 enrolled patients, 12 were enrolled before the protocol amendment was made effective (i.e. 2-weekly administration) and 7 were enrolled after the amendment (i.e. 3-weekly administration).

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles (pre-amendement) or 21 days x 6 cycles (post-amendment) or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue.

group.title: Pemetrexed - Before Amendment
group.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue.

group.title: Pemetrexed - After Amendment
group.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue.

measure.title: Disease Stages
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it's spread. Stages range from 0 (tumor has not spread) to IV (tumor has spread to other organs).

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

measure.title: Histopathological Grade
measure.description: Assesses the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. Grades range from 1 (least aggressive and best prognosis) to 4 (most aggressive and worst prognosis).

measure.title: Previous Surgery
measure.description: Participants having surgery could have more than one type of surgery.

measure.title: Height
measure.description: One participant in the Pemetrexed - Before Amendment group was missing a baseline height measurement.

measure.title: Weight
measure.description: One participant in the Pemetrexed - Before Amendment group was missing a baseline weight measurement.

outcome.title: Mean Deoxycytidine Kinase (dCK) Expression Evaluated at Cycle 1, Cycle 2, and Cycle 3
outcome.description: dCK and hENT expression (see Outcome #2) on normal lymphocytes were measured after Pemetrexed administration to evaluate if there was reproducible timing of maximum dCK expression, and to assess proper time interval between pemetrexed and gemcitabine for treatment of patients with advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC). Values are calculated as ratio between thereshold cycles (number of polymerase chain reaction [PCR] cycles) with respect to a reference gene; in this case glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH).
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: dCK - Cycle 1
group.description: Mean dCK expression evaluated at Cycle 1.

group.title: dCK - Cycle 2
group.description: Mean dCK expression evaluated at Cycle 2.

group.title: dCK - Cycle 3
group.description: Mean dCK expression evaluated at Cycle 3.

measure.title: Mean Deoxycytidine Kinase (dCK) Expression Evaluated at Cycle 1, Cycle 2, and Cycle 3
measure.description: dCK and hENT expression (see Outcome #2) on normal lymphocytes were measured after Pemetrexed administration to evaluate if there was reproducible timing of maximum dCK expression, and to assess proper time interval between pemetrexed and gemcitabine for treatment of patients with advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC). Values are calculated as ratio between thereshold cycles (number of polymerase chain reaction [PCR] cycles) with respect to a reference gene; in this case glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH).

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for 1 Hour Post-Dose (1 hour across cycles compared with pre-dose across cycles).
P-value for 2 Hours Post-Dose (2 hours across cycles compared with pre-dose across cycles).
P-value for 4 Hours Post-Dose (4 hours across cycles compared with pre-dose across cycles).
P-value for 6 Hours Post-Dose (6 hours across cycles compared with pre-dose across cycles).
P-value for 24 Hours Post-Dose (24 hours across cycles compared with pre-dose across cycles).
P-value for 48 Hours Post-Dose (48 hours across cycles compared with pre-dose across cycles).

outcome.title: Best Objective Tumor Response
outcome.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured response (every 14 days for 6 cycles)
outcome.population: Number of participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Pemetrexed - Before Amendment
group.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue.

group.title: Pemetrexed - After Amendment
group.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or patient decision to discontinue.

measure.title: Best Objective Tumor Response
measure.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.

Values are calculated as ratio between thereshold cycles (number of polymerase chain reaction [PCR] cycles) with respect to a reference gene; in this case glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
